questions.question: Which sentence from the selection shows that the pet is a cat?

choices.answer: Bryan had to feed his pet every day.
Bryan had to take his pet outside right away after school.
It was Bryan's job to clean out the litter box every 3 days.
Bryanʼs pet never bites.

questions.question: Which sentence from the selection suggests that Suzy likes to play basketball?

choices.answer: Suzy's mom makes Suzy practice basketball every day.
Suzy looks forward to her basketball games.
Suzy scored 5 points in her last basketball game.
Suzy and her mom get ice cream after her basketball games.

questions.question: Which sentence from the selection supports that the computer was not working properly?

choices.answer: Rita took three hours to finish her homework.
Ritaʼs homework was not finished.
Rita had to write out her story instead of typing it.
Ritaʼs homework was not done correctly.

questions.question: Which sentence suggests that Joanna rode her bike to school?

choices.answer: Joannaʼs hair was a little messy when she got to school.
Joanna crossed three streets on her way to school.
Joanna went four blocks on her way to school.
Joanna had to put her helmet inside the classroom closet.

questions.question: Which sentence supports that Jack is feeling sleepy?

choices.answer: Jack went to bed late because he was at a birthday party.
Jackʼs eyes were droopy and his eyelids felt really heavy.
Jack put his head down on the desk.
Jack was not paying attention to the lesson.

questions.question: Which of the following shows why Sam refused to play in the tournament?

choices.answer: SAM: Yeah, I think so, too.
SAM: Why? Because I 'm a girl?
SAM: Oh, I don't think so.
SAM: You wouldn't appreciate my talents, since I'm a girl!

questions.question: Which line supports the idea that Mark has changed the way he feels about a girl on the team?

choices.answer: MARK:I guess we can try it, but this kid had better be good.
MARK: Fine! Let's play.
MARK: I can't believe Sam won!
MARK: Hey, Carter, does she have a sister in town?

questions.question: Which line from the play supports the idea that Cara's proud of the work she's done with G-pa?

choices.answer: CARA: Is this good enough, Grandpa?
CARA: Grandma's coming!
CARA: We're out here, Grandma!
CARA: We did it with our own four hands!

questions.question: [Cara sands the wood. Grandpa hums happily as he works on replacing the cracked piece.]suggests

choices.answer: He is only good a repairing rocking chairs.
He is enjoying his task.
He has the tools needed to make repairs to the chair.
He is glad that someone is helping him repair the chair.

questions.question: Which sent. from the story shows that Marvin doesn't want to create more problems for his mom?

choices.answer: "I can wear my old shoes'" Marvin offered.
"It's not regular television," Marvin tried to explain.
Marvin didn't know what to do.
He slowly started up the stairs.
